text: Captain Kidd, or, by his real name, William Kidd, ( 1645 â€“ 23 May 1701) was a Scottish pirate and sailor. It is heard that he buried a treasure chest on a deserted island. The chest had a lot of gold and jewels in it. He was found guilty of murder and was executed by hanging at 'Execution Dock', Wapping, in London on 23 May 1701. == References == Category:Scottish criminals Category:People executed by hanging Category:Pirates Category:1645 births Category:1701 deaths
title: William Kidd
